page.title: 01Langham & The Area SSE
page.content: This area is of gently undulating farmland about 150ft above sea level. Langham built around a crossroads is the largest of the three villages with a considerable amount of new residential development, the others, much smaller, with only infilling within the village envelopes. The area is one of mixed farming, barley, oil-seed rape and sugar beet and some rough grazing for cattle. The fields are large with hedges and a small amount of hedgerow timber, a few areas given over to rough plantations. Old marsh pits occur in some fields and the remains of old gravel workings on the glacial Ercar. Employment is on the land, in a recently established glass house and in nearby towns. A number of holiday homes and much visited in the summer. A wide village street, a village green, flint
